NASA APOD

Simple iOS app to display the NASA Astronomy Picture of the Day

Swift · Objective-C · iOS · NASA APOD API

Learn about space on a daily basis.


A fun API

NASA APoD stands for NASA's Astronomy Picture of the Day. I wrote a simple iOS app to pull down the APoD using NASA's public API and then display it within the app. The app can display any APoD between June 16th, 1995, when the program started, and now. This application was a toy project and has not been published on the App Store.


A plethora of content

Choose an APoD for any day between June 16th, 1995, when NASA started the program, and today. Media can range from pictures of planets, telescopes, stars, comets, and so much more!

NASA APOD date picker interface


Spectacular Space

Get jaw-dropping images right to your phone on a daily basis. If NASA's blurb about the photo isn't enough for you, you can always tap on the image to go to NASA's website and learn more!

Sample APoD content for a given day
